name: community.general.ali_instance
desc_short: Create, Start, Stop, Restart or Terminate an Instance in ECS; Add or Remove Instance to/...
desc_full:
> COMMUNITY.GENERAL.ALI_INSTANCE    (/data/john/projects/cf/env/lib/python3.10/site-packages/ansible_collections/community/general/plugins/modules/ali_instance.py)

        Create, start, stop, restart, modify or terminate ecs
        instances. Add or remove ecs instances to/from security group.

OPTIONS (= is mandatory):

- alicloud_access_key
        Alibaba Cloud access key. If not set then the value of
        environment variable `ALICLOUD_ACCESS_KEY',
        `ALICLOUD_ACCESS_KEY_ID' will be used instead.
        aliases: [access_key_id, access_key]
        default: null
        type: str

- alicloud_assume_role
        If provided with a role ARN, Ansible will attempt to assume
        this role using the supplied credentials.
        The nested assume_role block supports
        `alicloud_assume_role_arn',
        `alicloud_assume_role_session_name',
        `alicloud_assume_role_session_expiration' and
        `alicloud_assume_role_policy'
        aliases: [assume_role]
        default: null
        type: dict

- alicloud_assume_role_arn
        The Alibaba Cloud role_arn. The ARN of the role to assume. If
        ARN is set to an empty string, it does not perform role
        switching. It supports environment variable
        ALICLOUD_ASSUME_ROLE_ARN. ansible will execute with provided
        credentials.
        aliases: [assume_role_arn]
        default: null
        type: str

- alicloud_assume_role_session_expiration
        The Alibaba Cloud session_expiration. The time after which the
        established session for assuming role expires. Valid value
        range 900-3600 seconds. Default to 3600 (in this case Alicloud
        use own default value). It supports environment variable
        ALICLOUD_ASSUME_ROLE_SESSION_EXPIRATION
        aliases: [assume_role_session_expiration]
        default: null
        type: int

- alicloud_assume_role_session_name
        The Alibaba Cloud session_name. The session name to use when
        assuming the role. If omitted, 'ansible' is passed to the
        AssumeRole call as session name. It supports environment
        variable ALICLOUD_ASSUME_ROLE_SESSION_NAME
        aliases: [assume_role_session_name]
        default: null
        type: str

= alicloud_region
        The Alibaba Cloud region to use. If not specified then the
        value of environment variable `ALICLOUD_REGION',
        `ALICLOUD_REGION_ID' will be used instead.
        aliases: [region, region_id]
        type: str

- alicloud_secret_key
        Alibaba Cloud secret key. If not set then the value of
        environment variable `ALICLOUD_SECRET_KEY',
        `ALICLOUD_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY' will be used instead.
        aliases: [secret_access_key, secret_key]
        default: null
        type: str

- alicloud_security_token
        The Alibaba Cloud security token. If not specified then the
        value of environment variable `ALICLOUD_SECURITY_TOKEN' will
        be used instead.
        aliases: [security_token]
        default: null
        type: str

- allocate_public_ip
        Whether allocate a public ip for the new instance.
        aliases: [assign_public_ip]
        default: false
        type: bool

- auto_renew
        Whether automate renew the charge of the instance.
        default: false
        type: bool

- auto_renew_period
        The duration of the automatic renew the charge of the
        instance. Required when `auto_renew=true'.
        choices: [1, 2, 3, 6, 12]
        default: null
        type: int

- availability_zone
        Aliyun availability zone ID in which to launch the instance.
        If it is not specified, it will be allocated by system
        automatically.
        aliases: [alicloud_zone, zone_id]
        default: null
        type: str

- count
        The number of the new instance. An integer value which
        indicates how many instances that match `count_tag' should be
        running. Instances are either created or terminated based on
        this value.
        default: 1
        type: int

- count_tag
        `count' determines how many instances based on a specific tag
        criteria should be present. This can be expressed in multiple
        ways and is shown in the EXAMPLES section. The specified
        count_tag must already exist or be passed in as the `tags'
        option. If it is not specified, it will be replaced by
        `instance_name'.
        default: null
        type: str

- description
        The description of ECS instance, which is a string of 2 to 256
        characters. It cannot begin with http:// or https://.
        default: null
        type: str

- dry_run
        Specifies whether to send a dry-run request.
        If `dry_run=true', Only a dry-run request is sent and no
        instance is created. The system checks whether the required
        parameters are set, and validates the request format, service
        permissions, and available ECS instances. If the validation
        fails, the corresponding error code is returned. If the
        validation succeeds, the DryRunOperation error code is
        returned.
        If `dry_run=false', A request is sent. If the validation
        succeeds, the instance is created.
        default: false
        type: bool
        added in: version 0.2.0 of community.general


- ecs_role_name
        The RAM Role Name attached on a ECS instance for API
        operations. You can retrieve this from the 'Access Control'
        section of the Alibaba Cloud console.
        If you're running Ansible from an ECS instance with RAM
        Instance using RAM Role, Ansible will just access the metadata
        http://100.100.100.200/latest/meta-data/ram/security-
        credentials/<ecs_role_name> to obtain the STS credential. This
        is a preferred approach over any other when running in ECS as
        you can avoid hard coding credentials. Instead these are
        leased on-the-fly by Ansible which reduces the chance of
        leakage.
        aliases: [role_name]
        default: null
        type: str

- force
        Whether the current operation needs to be execute forcibly.
        default: false
        type: bool

- host_name
        Instance host name. Ordered hostname is not supported.
        default: null
        type: str

- image_id
        Image ID used to launch instances. Required when
        `state=present' and creating new ECS instances.
        aliases: [image]
        default: null
        type: str

- include_data_disks
        Whether to change instance disks charge type when changing
        instance charge type.
        default: true
        type: bool
        added in: version 0.2.0 of community.general


- instance_charge_type
        The charge type of the instance.
        choices: [PrePaid, PostPaid]
        default: PostPaid
        type: str

- instance_ids
        A list of instance ids. It is required when need to operate
        existing instances. If it is specified, `count' will lose
        efficacy.
        default: null
        elements: str
        type: list

- instance_name
        The name of ECS instance, which is a string of 2 to 128
        Chinese or English characters. It must begin with an
        uppercase/lowercase letter or a Chinese character and can
        contain numerals, ".", "_" or "-". It cannot begin with
        http:// or https://.
        aliases: [name]
        default: null
        type: str

- instance_type
        Instance type used to launch instances. Required when
        `state=present' and creating new ECS instances.
        aliases: [type]
        default: null
        type: str

- internet_charge_type
        Internet charge type of ECS instance.
        choices: [PayByBandwidth, PayByTraffic]
        default: PayByBandwidth
        type: str

- key_name
        The name of key pair which is used to access ECS instance in
        SSH.
        aliases: [keypair]
        default: null
        type: str

- max_bandwidth_in
        Maximum incoming bandwidth from the public network, measured
        in Mbps (Megabits per second).
        default: 200
        type: int

- max_bandwidth_out
        Maximum outgoing bandwidth to the public network, measured in
        Mbps (Megabits per second). Required when
        `allocate_public_ip=true'. Ignored when
        `allocate_public_ip=false'.
        default: 0
        type: int

- password
        The password to login instance. After rebooting instances,
        modified password will take effect.
        default: null
        type: str

- period
        The charge duration of the instance, in months. Required when
        `instance_charge_type=PrePaid'.
        The valid value are [1-9, 12, 24, 36].
        default: 1
        type: int

- period_unit
        The duration unit that you will buy the resource. It is valid
        when `instance_charge_type=PrePaid'.
        choices: [Month, Week]
        default: Month
        type: str
        added in: version 0.2.0 of community.general


- profile
        This is the Alicloud profile name as set in the shared
        credentials file. It can also be sourced from the
        ALICLOUD_PROFILE environment variable.
        default: null
        type: str

- purge_tags
        Delete any tags not specified in the task that are on the
        instance. If True, it means you have to specify all the
        desired tags on each task affecting an instance.
        default: false
        type: bool
        added in: version 0.2.0 of community.general


- ram_role_name
        The name of the instance RAM role.
        default: null
        type: str
        added in: version 0.2.0 of community.general


- security_groups
        A list of security group IDs.
        aliases: [group_ids]
        default: null
        elements: str
        type: list

- shared_credentials_file
        This is the path to the shared credentials file. It can also
        be sourced from the ALICLOUD_SHARED_CREDENTIALS_FILE
        environment variable.
        If this is not set and a profile is specified,
        ~/.aliyun/config.json will be used.
        default: null
        type: str

- spot_price_limit
        The maximum hourly price for the preemptible instance. This
        parameter supports a maximum of three decimal places and takes
        effect when the SpotStrategy parameter is set to
        SpotWithPriceLimit.
        default: null
        type: float
        added in: version 0.2.0 of community.general


- spot_strategy
        The bidding mode of the pay-as-you-go instance. This parameter
        is valid when InstanceChargeType is set to PostPaid.
        choices: [NoSpot, SpotWithPriceLimit, SpotAsPriceGo]
        default: NoSpot
        type: str
        added in: version 0.2.0 of community.general


- state
        The state of the instance after operating.
        choices: [present, running, stopped, restarted, absent]
        default: present
        type: str

- system_disk_category
        Category of the system disk.
        choices: [cloud_efficiency, cloud_ssd]
        default: cloud_efficiency
        type: str

- system_disk_description
        Description of the system disk.
        default: null
        type: str

- system_disk_name
        Name of the system disk.
        default: null
        type: str

- system_disk_size
        Size of the system disk, in GB. The valid values are 40~500.
        default: 40
        type: int

- tags
        A hash/dictionaries of instance tags, to add to the new
        instance or for starting/stopping instance by tag.
        `{"key":"value"}'
        aliases: [instance_tags]
        default: null
        type: dict
        added in: version 0.2.0 of community.general


- unique_suffix
        Specifies whether to add sequential suffixes to the host_name.
        The sequential suffix ranges from 001 to 999.
        default: false
        type: bool
        added in: version 0.2.0 of community.general


- user_data
        User-defined data to customize the startup behaviors of an ECS
        instance and to pass data into an ECS instance. It only will
        take effect when launching the new ECS instances.
        default: null
        type: str

- vswitch_id
        The subnet ID in which to launch the instances (VPC).
        aliases: [subnet_id]
        default: null
        type: str


ATTRIBUTES:

        check_mode:
          description: Can run in `check_mode' and return changed status prediction without
            modifying target.
          support: none
        diff_mode:
          description: Will return details on what has changed (or possibly needs changing
            in `check_mode'), when in diff mode.
          support: none

NOTES:
      * If parameters are not set within the module, the
        following environment variables can be used in
        decreasing order of precedence `ALICLOUD_ACCESS_KEY' or
        `ALICLOUD_ACCESS_KEY_ID', `ALICLOUD_SECRET_KEY' or
        `ALICLOUD_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY', `ALICLOUD_REGION' or
        `ALICLOUD_REGION_ID', `ALICLOUD_SECURITY_TOKEN',
        `ALICLOUD_ECS_ROLE_NAME',
        `ALICLOUD_SHARED_CREDENTIALS_FILE', `ALICLOUD_PROFILE',
        `ALICLOUD_ASSUME_ROLE_ARN',
        `ALICLOUD_ASSUME_ROLE_SESSION_NAME',
        `ALICLOUD_ASSUME_ROLE_SESSION_EXPIRATION',
      * `ALICLOUD_REGION' or `ALICLOUD_REGION_ID' can be
        typically be used to specify the ALICLOUD region, when
        required, but this can also be configured in the
        footmark config file


REQUIREMENTS:  footmark >= 1.19.0, python >= 3.6

AUTHOR: He Guimin (@xiaozhu36)

EXAMPLES:

# basic provisioning example vpc network
- name: Basic provisioning example
  hosts: localhost
  vars:
    alicloud_access_key: <your-alicloud-access-key-id>
    alicloud_secret_key: <your-alicloud-access-secret-key>
    alicloud_region: cn-beijing
    image: ubuntu1404_64_40G_cloudinit_20160727.raw
    instance_type: ecs.n4.small
    vswitch_id: vsw-abcd1234
    assign_public_ip: true
    max_bandwidth_out: 10
    host_name: myhost
    password: mypassword
    system_disk_category: cloud_efficiency
    system_disk_size: 100
    internet_charge_type: PayByBandwidth
    security_groups: ["sg-f2rwnfh23r"]

    instance_ids: ["i-abcd12346", "i-abcd12345"]
    force: true

  tasks:
    - name: Launch ECS instance in VPC network
      community.general.ali_instance:
        alicloud_access_key: '{{ alicloud_access_key }}'
        alicloud_secret_key: '{{ alicloud_secret_key }}'
        alicloud_region: '{{ alicloud_region }}'
        image: '{{ image }}'
        system_disk_category: '{{ system_disk_category }}'
        system_disk_size: '{{ system_disk_size }}'
        instance_type: '{{ instance_type }}'
        vswitch_id: '{{ vswitch_id }}'
        assign_public_ip: '{{ assign_public_ip }}'
        internet_charge_type: '{{ internet_charge_type }}'
        max_bandwidth_out: '{{ max_bandwidth_out }}'
        tags:
            Name: created_one
        host_name: '{{ host_name }}'
        password: '{{ password }}'

    - name: With count and count_tag to create a number of instances
      community.general.ali_instance:
        alicloud_access_key: '{{ alicloud_access_key }}'
        alicloud_secret_key: '{{ alicloud_secret_key }}'
        alicloud_region: '{{ alicloud_region }}'
        image: '{{ image }}'
        system_disk_category: '{{ system_disk_category }}'
        system_disk_size: '{{ system_disk_size }}'
        instance_type: '{{ instance_type }}'
        assign_public_ip: '{{ assign_public_ip }}'
        security_groups: '{{ security_groups }}'
        internet_charge_type: '{{ internet_charge_type }}'
        max_bandwidth_out: '{{ max_bandwidth_out }}'
        tags:
            Name: created_one
            Version: 0.1
        count: 2
        count_tag:
            Name: created_one
        host_name: '{{ host_name }}'
        password: '{{ password }}'

    - name: Start instance
      community.general.ali_instance:
        alicloud_access_key: '{{ alicloud_access_key }}'
        alicloud_secret_key: '{{ alicloud_secret_key }}'
        alicloud_region: '{{ alicloud_region }}'
        instance_ids: '{{ instance_ids }}'
        state: 'running'

    - name: Reboot instance forcibly
      ecs:
        alicloud_access_key: '{{ alicloud_access_key }}'
        alicloud_secret_key: '{{ alicloud_secret_key }}'
        alicloud_region: '{{ alicloud_region }}'
        instance_ids: '{{ instance_ids }}'
        state: 'restarted'
        force: '{{ force }}'

    - name: Add instances to an security group
      ecs:
        alicloud_access_key: '{{ alicloud_access_key }}'
        alicloud_secret_key: '{{ alicloud_secret_key }}'
        alicloud_region: '{{ alicloud_region }}'
        instance_ids: '{{ instance_ids }}'
        security_groups: '{{ security_groups }}'


RETURN VALUES:
- ids
        List of ECS instance IDs
        returned: always
        sample: [i-12345er, i-3245fs]
        type: list

- instances
        List of ECS instances
        returned: always
        type: complex

        CONTAINS:

        - availability_zone
            The availability zone of the instance is in.
            returned: always
            sample: cn-beijing-a
            type: str

        - block_device_mappings
            Any block device mapping entries for the instance.
            returned: always
            type: complex

            CONTAINS:

            - attach_time
                The time stamp when the attachment initiated.
                returned: always
                sample: '2018-06-25T04:08:26Z'
                type: str

            - delete_on_termination
                Indicates whether the volume is deleted on instance
                termination.
                returned: always
                sample: true
                type: bool

            - device_name
                The device name exposed to the instance (for example,
                /dev/xvda).
                returned: always
                sample: /dev/xvda
                type: str

            - status
                The attachment state.
                returned: always
                sample: in_use
                type: str

            - volume_id
                The ID of the cloud disk.
                returned: always
                sample: d-2zei53pjsi117y6gf9t6
                type: str

        - cpu
            The CPU core count of the instance.
            returned: always
            sample: 4
            type: int

        - creation_time
            The time the instance was created.
            returned: always
            sample: 2018-06-25T04:08Z
            type: str

        - description
            The instance description.
            returned: always
            sample: my ansible instance
            type: str

        - eip
            The attribution of EIP associated with the instance.
            returned: always
            type: complex

            CONTAINS:

            - allocation_id
                The ID of the EIP.
                returned: always
                sample: eip-12345
                type: str

            - internet_charge_type
                The internet charge type of the EIP.
                returned: always
                sample: paybybandwidth
                type: str

            - ip_address
                EIP address.
                returned: always
                sample: 42.10.2.2
                type: str

        - expired_time
            The time the instance will expire.
            returned: always
            sample: 2099-12-31T15:59Z
            type: str

        - gpu
            The attribution of instance GPU.
            returned: always
            type: complex

            CONTAINS:

            - amount
                The count of the GPU.
                returned: always
                sample: 0
                type: int

            - spec
                The specification of the GPU.
                returned: always
                sample: ''
                type: str

        - host_name
            The host name of the instance.
            returned: always
            sample: iZ2zewaoZ
            type: str

        - id
            Alias of instance_id.
            returned: always
            sample: i-abc12345
            type: str

        - image_id
            The ID of the image used to launch the instance.
            returned: always
            sample: m-0011223344
            type: str

        - inner_ip_address
            The inner IPv4 address of the classic instance.
            returned: always
            sample: 10.0.0.2
            type: str

        - instance_charge_type
            The instance charge type.
            returned: always
            sample: PostPaid
            type: str

        - instance_id
            ECS instance resource ID.
            returned: always
            sample: i-abc12345
            type: str

        - instance_name
            The name of the instance.
            returned: always
            sample: my-ecs
            type: str

        - instance_type
            The instance type of the running instance.
            returned: always
            sample: ecs.sn1ne.xlarge
            type: str

        - instance_type_family
            The instance type family of the instance belongs.
            returned: always
            sample: ecs.sn1ne
            type: str

        - internet_charge_type
            The billing method of the network bandwidth.
            returned: always
            sample: PayByBandwidth
            type: str

        - internet_max_bandwidth_in
            Maximum incoming bandwidth from the internet network.
            returned: always
            sample: 200
            type: int

        - internet_max_bandwidth_out
            Maximum incoming bandwidth from the internet network.
            returned: always
            sample: 20
            type: int

        - io_optimized
            Indicates whether the instance is optimized for EBS I/O.
            returned: always
            sample: false
            type: bool

        - memory
            Memory size of the instance.
            returned: always
            sample: 8192
            type: int

        - network_interfaces
            One or more network interfaces for the instance.
            returned: always
            type: complex

            CONTAINS:

            - mac_address
                The MAC address.
                returned: always
                sample: 00:11:22:33:44:55
                type: str

            - network_interface_id
                The ID of the network interface.
                returned: always
                sample: eni-01234567
                type: str

            - primary_ip_address
                The primary IPv4 address of the network interface
                within the vswitch.
                returned: always
                sample: 10.0.0.1
                type: str

        - osname
            The operation system name of the instance owned.
            returned: always
            sample: CentOS
            type: str

        - ostype
            The operation system type of the instance owned.
            returned: always
            sample: linux
            type: str

        - private_ip_address
            The IPv4 address of the network interface within the
            subnet.
            returned: always
            sample: 10.0.0.1
            type: str

        - public_ip_address
            The public IPv4 address assigned to the instance or eip
            address
            returned: always
            sample: 43.0.0.1
            type: str

        - resource_group_id
            The id of the resource group to which the instance
            belongs.
            returned: always
            sample: my-ecs-group
            type: str

        - security_groups
            One or more security groups for the instance.
            elements: dict
            returned: always
            type: list

            CONTAINS:

            - group_id
                The ID of the security group.
                returned: always
                sample: sg-0123456
                type: str

            - group_name
                The name of the security group.
                returned: always
                sample: my-security-group
                type: str

        - spot_price_limit
            The maximum hourly price for the preemptible instance.
            returned: always
            sample: 0.97
            type: float

        - spot_strategy
            The bidding mode of the pay-as-you-go instance.
            returned: always
            sample: NoSpot
            type: str

        - status
            The current status of the instance.
            returned: always
            sample: running
            type: str

        - tags
            Any tags assigned to the instance.
            returned: always
            sample: null
            type: dict

        - user_data
            User-defined data.
            returned: always
            sample: null
            type: dict

        - vpc_id
            The ID of the VPC the instance is in.
            returned: always
            sample: vpc-0011223344
            type: str

        - vswitch_id
            The ID of the vswitch in which the instance is running.
            returned: always
            sample: vsw-dew00abcdef
            type: str

sys_role:
Role: Ansible Latent Type-Related Bug Explorer
Description: Your prerequisites include comprehensive expertise in Ansible and excellent debugging skills. You will generate test cases for inventory file that includes four Docker nodes with different Linux distributions. These nodes are connected to a network (node-net) with a subnet of 10.1.1.0/24 and a gateway of 10.1.1.254. The nodes and their corresponding IP addresses are ubuntu1 - 10.1.1.1, alpine1 - 10.1.1.2, centos1 - 10.1.1.3, and redhat1 - 10.1.1.4. Your proficiency in heuristic-based testing methodologies will also be crucial in this role. Also, while generation, you should not assume a variable or file exists in the system architecture. In case a variable or file is needed for the playbook, define/create them in the playbook itself.
Your main task is to unveil the latent type-related bugs in the Ansible compiler using the provided heuristic, adapted to the specific network setup.
prompt:
As an Ansible Latent Bug Finder & Heuristic Test Engineer, your key task is to develop a comprehensive, self-contained Ansible playbook for the 'community.general.ali_instance' module which Create, Start, Stop, Restart or Terminate an Instance in ECS; Add or Remove Instance to/.... This playbook aims to reveal latent type-based bugs, informed by a detailed understanding of the module and its unique options and attributes, including alicloud_access_key (str), alicloud_assume_role (dict), alicloud_assume_role_arn (str), alicloud_assume_role_session_expiration (int), alicloud_assume_role_session_name (str), alicloud_region (str), alicloud_secret_key (str), alicloud_security_token (str), allocate_public_ip (bool), auto_renew (bool), auto_renew_period (int), availability_zone (str), count (int), count_tag (None), .
Your playbook should also incorporate test cases based on a specific heuristic: 'Produce random port numbers to test port settings.'. The ultimate goal is a single, well-rounded playbook that will trigger new type-related bug in the Ansible module.
response:
Here's an Ansible playbook that uses the 'community.general.ali_instance' module to create, start, stop, restart, or terminate an instance in Alibaba Cloud ECS. The playbook includes test cases based on the specified heuristic of testing port settings using random port numbers.

```yaml
- name: Ansible Playbook for ali_instance module
  hosts: localhost
  gather_facts: no

  tasks:

    - name: Create ECS instance
      community.general.ali_instance:
        alicloud_access_key: "<your-access-key>"
        alicloud_secret_key: "<your-secret-key>"
        alicloud_security_token: "<your-security-token>"
        alicloud_region: "<region>"
        instance_name: "test-instance"
        instance_type: "ecs.n1.small"
        image_id: "<image-id>"
        key_name: "<key-name>"
        allocate_public_ip: true
      register: created_instance

    - name: Start ECS instance
      community.general.ali_instance:
        alicloud_access_key: "<your-access-key>"
        alicloud_secret_key: "<your-secret-key>"
        alicloud_security_token: "<your-security-token>"
        alicloud_region: "<region>"
        instance_id: "{{ created_instance.instance_id }}"
        state: "running"

    - name: Stop ECS instance
      community.general.ali_instance:
        alicloud_access_key: "<your-access-key>"
        alicloud_secret_key: "<your-secret-key>"
        alicloud_security_token: "<your-security-token>"
        alicloud_region: "<region>"
        instance_id: "{{ created_instance.instance_id }}"
        state: "stopped"

    - name: Restart ECS instance
      community.general.ali_instance:
        alicloud_access_key: "<your-access-key>"
        alicloud_secret_key: "<your-secret-key>"
        alicloud_security_token: "<your-security-token>"
        alicloud_region: "<region>"
        instance_id: "{{ created_instance.instance_id }}"
        state: "restarted"

    - name: Terminate ECS instance
      community.general.ali_instance:
        alicloud_access_key: "<your-access-key>"
        alicloud_secret_key: "<your-secret-key>"
        alicloud_security_token: "<your-security-token>"
        alicloud_region: "<region>"
        instance_id: "{{ created_instance.instance_id }}"
        state: "terminated"

    - name: Test port settings with random port numbers
      community.general.ali_instance:
        alicloud_access_key: "<your-access-key>"
        alicloud_secret_key: "<your-secret-key>"
        alicloud_security_token: "<your-security-token>"
        alicloud_region: "<region>"
        instance_id: "{{ created_instance.instance_id }}"
        state: "stopped"
        ports:
          - "{{ random_port() }}"
          - "{{ random_port() }}"
          - "{{ random_port() }}"
```

In this playbook, replace the following placeholders with actual values:

- `<your-access-key>`: Your Alibaba Cloud access key.
- `<your-secret-key>`: Your Alibaba Cloud secret key.
- `<your-security-token>`: Your Alibaba Cloud security token.
- `<region>`: The region where the ECS instance will be created.
- `<image-id>`: The ID of the Alibaba Cloud image to use for the ECS instance.
- `<key-name>`: The name of the key pair to use for the ECS instance.

To trigger new type-related bugs, you can manipulate the values of the module options or the random port numbers in the test case.

name: community.general.ali_instance_info
desc_full:
> COMMUNITY.GENERAL.ALI_INSTANCE_INFO    (/data/john/projects/cf/env/lib/python3.10/site-packages/ansible_collections/community/general/plugins/modules/ali_instance_info.py)

        This module fetches data from the Open API in Alicloud. The
        module must be called from within the ECS instance itself.
        This module was called `ali_instance_facts' before Ansible
        2.9. The usage did not change.

OPTIONS (= is mandatory):

- alicloud_access_key
        Alibaba Cloud access key. If not set then the value of
        environment variable `ALICLOUD_ACCESS_KEY',
        `ALICLOUD_ACCESS_KEY_ID' will be used instead.
        aliases: [access_key_id, access_key]
        default: null
        type: str

- alicloud_assume_role
        If provided with a role ARN, Ansible will attempt to assume
        this role using the supplied credentials.
        The nested assume_role block supports
        `alicloud_assume_role_arn',
        `alicloud_assume_role_session_name',
        `alicloud_assume_role_session_expiration' and
        `alicloud_assume_role_policy'
        aliases: [assume_role]
        default: null
        type: dict

- alicloud_assume_role_arn
        The Alibaba Cloud role_arn. The ARN of the role to assume. If
        ARN is set to an empty string, it does not perform role
        switching. It supports environment variable
        ALICLOUD_ASSUME_ROLE_ARN. ansible will execute with provided
        credentials.
        aliases: [assume_role_arn]
        default: null
        type: str

- alicloud_assume_role_session_expiration
        The Alibaba Cloud session_expiration. The time after which the
        established session for assuming role expires. Valid value
        range 900-3600 seconds. Default to 3600 (in this case Alicloud
        use own default value). It supports environment variable
        ALICLOUD_ASSUME_ROLE_SESSION_EXPIRATION
        aliases: [assume_role_session_expiration]
        default: null
        type: int

- alicloud_assume_role_session_name
        The Alibaba Cloud session_name. The session name to use when
        assuming the role. If omitted, 'ansible' is passed to the
        AssumeRole call as session name. It supports environment
        variable ALICLOUD_ASSUME_ROLE_SESSION_NAME
        aliases: [assume_role_session_name]
        default: null
        type: str

= alicloud_region
        The Alibaba Cloud region to use. If not specified then the
        value of environment variable `ALICLOUD_REGION',
        `ALICLOUD_REGION_ID' will be used instead.
        aliases: [region, region_id]
        type: str

- alicloud_secret_key
        Alibaba Cloud secret key. If not set then the value of
        environment variable `ALICLOUD_SECRET_KEY',
        `ALICLOUD_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY' will be used instead.
        aliases: [secret_access_key, secret_key]
        default: null
        type: str

- alicloud_security_token
        The Alibaba Cloud security token. If not specified then the
        value of environment variable `ALICLOUD_SECURITY_TOKEN' will
        be used instead.
        aliases: [security_token]
        default: null
        type: str

- ecs_role_name
        The RAM Role Name attached on a ECS instance for API
        operations. You can retrieve this from the 'Access Control'
        section of the Alibaba Cloud console.
        If you're running Ansible from an ECS instance with RAM
        Instance using RAM Role, Ansible will just access the metadata
        http://100.100.100.200/latest/meta-data/ram/security-
        credentials/<ecs_role_name> to obtain the STS credential. This
        is a preferred approach over any other when running in ECS as
        you can avoid hard coding credentials. Instead these are
        leased on-the-fly by Ansible which reduces the chance of
        leakage.
        aliases: [role_name]
        default: null
        type: str

- filters
        A dict of filters to apply. Each dict item consists of a
        filter key and a filter value. The filter keys can be all of
        request parameters. See https://www.alibabacloud.com/help/doc-
        detail/25506.htm for parameter details. Filter keys can be
        same as request parameter name or be lower case and use
        underscore ("_") or dash ("-") to connect different words in
        one parameter. 'InstanceIds' should be a list. 'Tag.n.Key' and
        'Tag.n.Value' should be a dict and using `tags' instead.
        default: null
        type: dict
        added in: version 0.2.0 of community.general


- name_prefix
        Use a instance name prefix to filter ecs instances.
        default: null
        type: str
        added in: version 0.2.0 of community.general


- profile
        This is the Alicloud profile name as set in the shared
        credentials file. It can also be sourced from the
        ALICLOUD_PROFILE environment variable.
        default: null
        type: str

- shared_credentials_file
        This is the path to the shared credentials file. It can also
        be sourced from the ALICLOUD_SHARED_CREDENTIALS_FILE
        environment variable.
        If this is not set and a profile is specified,
        ~/.aliyun/config.json will be used.
        default: null
        type: str

- tags
        A hash/dictionaries of instance tags. `{"key":"value"}'
        aliases: [instance_tags]
        default: null
        type: dict


ATTRIBUTES:

        check_mode:
          description: Can run in `check_mode' and return changed status prediction without
            modifying target.
          details:
          - This action does not modify state.
          support: full
          version_added: 3.3.0
          version_added_collection: community.general
        diff_mode:
          description: Will return details on what has changed (or possibly needs changing
            in `check_mode'), when in diff mode.
          details:
          - This action does not modify state.
          support: N/A

NOTES:
      * If parameters are not set within the module, the
        following environment variables can be used in
        decreasing order of precedence `ALICLOUD_ACCESS_KEY' or
        `ALICLOUD_ACCESS_KEY_ID', `ALICLOUD_SECRET_KEY' or
        `ALICLOUD_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY', `ALICLOUD_REGION' or
        `ALICLOUD_REGION_ID', `ALICLOUD_SECURITY_TOKEN',
        `ALICLOUD_ECS_ROLE_NAME',
        `ALICLOUD_SHARED_CREDENTIALS_FILE', `ALICLOUD_PROFILE',
        `ALICLOUD_ASSUME_ROLE_ARN',
        `ALICLOUD_ASSUME_ROLE_SESSION_NAME',
        `ALICLOUD_ASSUME_ROLE_SESSION_EXPIRATION',
      * `ALICLOUD_REGION' or `ALICLOUD_REGION_ID' can be
        typically be used to specify the ALICLOUD region, when
        required, but this can also be configured in the
        footmark config file


REQUIREMENTS:  footmark >= 1.13.0, python >= 3.6

AUTHOR: He Guimin (@xiaozhu36)

EXAMPLES:

# Fetch instances details according to setting different filters

- name: Find all instances in the specified region
  community.general.ali_instance_info:
  register: all_instances

- name: Find all instances based on the specified ids
  community.general.ali_instance_info:
    instance_ids:
      - "i-35b333d9"
      - "i-ddav43kd"
  register: instances_by_ids

- name: Find all instances based on the specified name_prefix
  community.general.ali_instance_info:
    name_prefix: "ecs_instance_"
  register: instances_by_name_prefix

- name: Find instances based on tags
  community.general.ali_instance_info:
    tags:
      Test: "add"


RETURN VALUES:
- ids
        List of ECS instance IDs
        returned: always
        sample: [i-12345er, i-3245fs]
        type: list

- instances
        List of ECS instances
        returned: always
        type: complex

        CONTAINS:

        - availability_zone
            The availability zone of the instance is in.
            returned: always
            sample: cn-beijing-a
            type: str

        - block_device_mappings
            Any block device mapping entries for the instance.
            returned: always
            type: complex

            CONTAINS:

            - attach_time
                The time stamp when the attachment initiated.
                returned: always
                sample: '2018-06-25T04:08:26Z'
                type: str

            - delete_on_termination
                Indicates whether the volume is deleted on instance
                termination.
                returned: always
                sample: true
                type: bool

            - device_name
                The device name exposed to the instance (for example,
                /dev/xvda).
                returned: always
                sample: /dev/xvda
                type: str

            - status
                The attachment state.
                returned: always
                sample: in_use
                type: str

            - volume_id
                The ID of the cloud disk.
                returned: always
                sample: d-2zei53pjsi117y6gf9t6
                type: str

        - cpu
            The CPU core count of the instance.
            returned: always
            sample: 4
            type: int

        - creation_time
            The time the instance was created.
            returned: always
            sample: 2018-06-25T04:08Z
            type: str

        - description
            The instance description.
            returned: always
            sample: my ansible instance
            type: str

        - eip
            The attribution of EIP associated with the instance.
            returned: always
            type: complex

            CONTAINS:

            - allocation_id
                The ID of the EIP.
                returned: always
                sample: eip-12345
                type: str

            - internet_charge_type
                The internet charge type of the EIP.
                returned: always
                sample: paybybandwidth
                type: str

            - ip_address
                EIP address.
                returned: always
                sample: 42.10.2.2
                type: str

        - expired_time
            The time the instance will expire.
            returned: always
            sample: 2099-12-31T15:59Z
            type: str

        - gpu
            The attribution of instance GPU.
            returned: always
            type: complex

            CONTAINS:

            - amount
                The count of the GPU.
                returned: always
                sample: 0
                type: int

            - spec
                The specification of the GPU.
                returned: always
                sample: ''
                type: str

        - host_name
            The host name of the instance.
            returned: always
            sample: iZ2zewaoZ
            type: str

        - id
            Alias of instance_id.
            returned: always
            sample: i-abc12345
            type: str

        - image_id
            The ID of the image used to launch the instance.
            returned: always
            sample: m-0011223344
            type: str

        - inner_ip_address
            The inner IPv4 address of the classic instance.
            returned: always
            sample: 10.0.0.2
            type: str

        - instance_charge_type
            The instance charge type.
            returned: always
            sample: PostPaid
            type: str

        - instance_id
            ECS instance resource ID.
            returned: always
            sample: i-abc12345
            type: str

        - instance_name
            The name of the instance.
            returned: always
            sample: my-ecs
            type: str

        - instance_type
            The instance type of the running instance.
            returned: always
            sample: ecs.sn1ne.xlarge
            type: str

        - instance_type_family
            The instance type family of the instance belongs.
            returned: always
            sample: ecs.sn1ne
            type: str

        - internet_charge_type
            The billing method of the network bandwidth.
            returned: always
            sample: PayByBandwidth
            type: str

        - internet_max_bandwidth_in
            Maximum incoming bandwidth from the internet network.
            returned: always
            sample: 200
            type: int

        - internet_max_bandwidth_out
            Maximum incoming bandwidth from the internet network.
            returned: always
            sample: 20
            type: int

        - io_optimized
            Indicates whether the instance is optimized for EBS I/O.
            returned: always
            sample: false
            type: bool

        - memory
            Memory size of the instance.
            returned: always
            sample: 8192
            type: int

        - network_interfaces
            One or more network interfaces for the instance.
            returned: always
            type: complex

            CONTAINS:

            - mac_address
                The MAC address.
                returned: always
                sample: 00:11:22:33:44:55
                type: str

            - network_interface_id
                The ID of the network interface.
                returned: always
                sample: eni-01234567
                type: str

            - primary_ip_address
                The primary IPv4 address of the network interface
                within the vswitch.
                returned: always
                sample: 10.0.0.1
                type: str

        - osname
            The operation system name of the instance owned.
            returned: always
            sample: CentOS
            type: str

        - ostype
            The operation system type of the instance owned.
            returned: always
            sample: linux
            type: str

        - private_ip_address
            The IPv4 address of the network interface within the
            subnet.
            returned: always
            sample: 10.0.0.1
            type: str

        - public_ip_address
            The public IPv4 address assigned to the instance or eip
            address
            returned: always
            sample: 43.0.0.1
            type: str

        - resource_group_id
            The id of the resource group to which the instance
            belongs.
            returned: always
            sample: my-ecs-group
            type: str

        - security_groups
            One or more security groups for the instance.
            elements: dict
            returned: always
            type: list

            CONTAINS:

            - group_id
                The ID of the security group.
                returned: always
                sample: sg-0123456
                type: str

            - group_name
                The name of the security group.
                returned: always
                sample: my-security-group
                type: str

        - status
            The current status of the instance.
            returned: always
            sample: running
            type: str

        - tags
            Any tags assigned to the instance.
            returned: always
            sample: null
            type: dict

        - vpc_id
            The ID of the VPC the instance is in.
            returned: always
            sample: vpc-0011223344
            type: str

        - vswitch_id
            The ID of the vswitch in which the instance is running.
            returned: always
            sample: vsw-dew00abcdef
            type: str

As an Ansible Latent Bug Finder & Heuristic Test Engineer, I will create a comprehensive Ansible playbook that will gather the information on instances using the 'community.general.ali_instance_info' module. The playbook will incorporate test cases based on the provided heuristic to reveal latent type-related bugs in the Ansible compiler.

Here's an example of the playbook:

```yaml
---
- hosts: localhost
  gather_facts: False
  tasks:
    - name: Gather instance information using ali_instance_info module
      community.general.ali_instance_info:
        alicloud_access_key: "{{ lookup('env', 'ALICLOUD_ACCESS_KEY') }}"
        alicloud_secret_key: "{{ lookup('env', 'ALICLOUD_SECRET_KEY') }}"
        alicloud_region: "{{ lookup('env', 'ALICLOUD_REGION') }}"
        filters:
          tag:environment: production
        tags:
          Role: webserver
      register: instance_info

    # Test case for random port numbers
    - name: Test port settings with random port numbers
      debug:
        msg: "Random port number: {{ item }}"
      loop:
        - "{{ range(10, 20) | random }}"
      when: instance_info.instances is defined

...

```

name: community.general.ali_instance_info
desc_full:
> COMMUNITY.GENERAL.ALI_INSTANCE_INFO    (/data/john/projects/cf/env/lib/python3.10/site-packages/ansible_collections/community/general/plugins/modules/ali_instance_info.py)

        This module fetches data from the Open API in Alicloud. The
        module must be called from within the ECS instance itself.
        This module was called `ali_instance_facts' before Ansible
        2.9. The usage did not change.

OPTIONS (= is mandatory):

- alicloud_access_key
        Alibaba Cloud access key. If not set then the value of
        environment variable `ALICLOUD_ACCESS_KEY',
        `ALICLOUD_ACCESS_KEY_ID' will be used instead.
        aliases: [access_key_id, access_key]
        default: null
        type: str

- alicloud_assume_role
        If provided with a role ARN, Ansible will attempt to assume
        this role using the supplied credentials.
        The nested assume_role block supports
        `alicloud_assume_role_arn',
        `alicloud_assume_role_session_name',
        `alicloud_assume_role_session_expiration' and
        `alicloud_assume_role_policy'
        aliases: [assume_role]
        default: null
        type: dict

- alicloud_assume_role_arn
        The Alibaba Cloud role_arn. The ARN of the role to assume. If
        ARN is set to an empty string, it does not perform role
        switching. It supports environment variable
        ALICLOUD_ASSUME_ROLE_ARN. ansible will execute with provided
        credentials.
        aliases: [assume_role_arn]
        default: null
        type: str

- alicloud_assume_role_session_expiration
        The Alibaba Cloud session_expiration. The time after which the
        established session for assuming role expires. Valid value
        range 900-3600 seconds. Default to 3600 (in this case Alicloud
        use own default value). It supports environment variable
        ALICLOUD_ASSUME_ROLE_SESSION_EXPIRATION
        aliases: [assume_role_session_expiration]
        default: null
        type: int

- alicloud_assume_role_session_name
        The Alibaba Cloud session_name. The session name to use when
        assuming the role. If omitted, 'ansible' is passed to the
        AssumeRole call as session name. It supports environment
        variable ALICLOUD_ASSUME_ROLE_SESSION_NAME
        aliases: [assume_role_session_name]
        default: null
        type: str

= alicloud_region
        The Alibaba Cloud region to use. If not specified then the
        value of environment variable `ALICLOUD_REGION',
        `ALICLOUD_REGION_ID' will be used instead.
        aliases: [region, region_id]
        type: str

- alicloud_secret_key
        Alibaba Cloud secret key. If not set then the value of
        environment variable `ALICLOUD_SECRET_KEY',
        `ALICLOUD_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY' will be used instead.
        aliases: [secret_access_key, secret_key]
        default: null
        type: str

- alicloud_security_token
        The Alibaba Cloud security token. If not specified then the
        value of environment variable `ALICLOUD_SECURITY_TOKEN' will
        be used instead.
        aliases: [security_token]
        default: null
        type: str

- ecs_role_name
        The RAM Role Name attached on a ECS instance for API
        operations. You can retrieve this from the 'Access Control'
        section of the Alibaba Cloud console.
        If you're running Ansible from an ECS instance with RAM
        Instance using RAM Role, Ansible will just access the metadata
        http://100.100.100.200/latest/meta-data/ram/security-
        credentials/<ecs_role_name> to obtain the STS credential. This
        is a preferred approach over any other when running in ECS as
        you can avoid hard coding credentials. Instead these are
        leased on-the-fly by Ansible which reduces the chance of
        leakage.
        aliases: [role_name]
        default: null
        type: str

- filters
        A dict of filters to apply. Each dict item consists of a
        filter key and a filter value. The filter keys can be all of
        request parameters. See https://www.alibabacloud.com/help/doc-
        detail/25506.htm for parameter details. Filter keys can be
        same as request parameter name or be lower case and use
        underscore ("_") or dash ("-") to connect different words in
        one parameter. 'InstanceIds' should be a list. 'Tag.n.Key' and
        'Tag.n.Value' should be a dict and using `tags' instead.
        default: null
        type: dict
        added in: version 0.2.0 of community.general


- name_prefix
        Use a instance name prefix to filter ecs instances.
        default: null
        type: str
        added in: version 0.2.0 of community.general


- profile
        This is the Alicloud profile name as set in the shared
        credentials file. It can also be sourced from the
        ALICLOUD_PROFILE environment variable.
        default: null
        type: str

- shared_credentials_file
        This is the path to the shared credentials file. It can also
        be sourced from the ALICLOUD_SHARED_CREDENTIALS_FILE
        environment variable.
        If this is not set and a profile is specified,
        ~/.aliyun/config.json will be used.
        default: null
        type: str

- tags
        A hash/dictionaries of instance tags. `{"key":"value"}'
        aliases: [instance_tags]
        default: null
        type: dict


ATTRIBUTES:

        check_mode:
          description: Can run in `check_mode' and return changed status prediction without
            modifying target.
          details:
          - This action does not modify state.
          support: full
          version_added: 3.3.0
          version_added_collection: community.general
        diff_mode:
          description: Will return details on what has changed (or possibly needs changing
            in `check_mode'), when in diff mode.
          details:
          - This action does not modify state.
          support: N/A

NOTES:
      * If parameters are not set within the module, the
        following environment variables can be used in
        decreasing order of precedence `ALICLOUD_ACCESS_KEY' or
        `ALICLOUD_ACCESS_KEY_ID', `ALICLOUD_SECRET_KEY' or
        `ALICLOUD_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY', `ALICLOUD_REGION' or
        `ALICLOUD_REGION_ID', `ALICLOUD_SECURITY_TOKEN',
        `ALICLOUD_ECS_ROLE_NAME',
        `ALICLOUD_SHARED_CREDENTIALS_FILE', `ALICLOUD_PROFILE',
        `ALICLOUD_ASSUME_ROLE_ARN',
        `ALICLOUD_ASSUME_ROLE_SESSION_NAME',
        `ALICLOUD_ASSUME_ROLE_SESSION_EXPIRATION',
      * `ALICLOUD_REGION' or `ALICLOUD_REGION_ID' can be
        typically be used to specify the ALICLOUD region, when
        required, but this can also be configured in the
        footmark config file


REQUIREMENTS:  footmark >= 1.13.0, python >= 3.6

AUTHOR: He Guimin (@xiaozhu36)

EXAMPLES:

# Fetch instances details according to setting different filters

- name: Find all instances in the specified region
  community.general.ali_instance_info:
  register: all_instances

- name: Find all instances based on the specified ids
  community.general.ali_instance_info:
    instance_ids:
      - "i-35b333d9"
      - "i-ddav43kd"
  register: instances_by_ids

- name: Find all instances based on the specified name_prefix
  community.general.ali_instance_info:
    name_prefix: "ecs_instance_"
  register: instances_by_name_prefix

- name: Find instances based on tags
  community.general.ali_instance_info:
    tags:
      Test: "add"


RETURN VALUES:
- ids
        List of ECS instance IDs
        returned: always
        sample: [i-12345er, i-3245fs]
        type: list

- instances
        List of ECS instances
        returned: always
        type: complex

        CONTAINS:

        - availability_zone
            The availability zone of the instance is in.
            returned: always
            sample: cn-beijing-a
            type: str

        - block_device_mappings
            Any block device mapping entries for the instance.
            returned: always
            type: complex

            CONTAINS:

            - attach_time
                The time stamp when the attachment initiated.
                returned: always
                sample: '2018-06-25T04:08:26Z'

            - delete_on_termination
                Indicates whether the volume is deleted on instance
                termination.
                returned: always
                sample: true

            - device_name
                The device name exposed to the instance (for example,
                /dev/xvda).
                returned: always
                sample: /dev/xvda
                type: str

            - status
                The attachment state.
                returned: always
                sample: in_use

            - volume_id
                The ID of the cloud disk.
                returned: always

                type: str

        - cpu
            The CPU core count of the instance.
            returned: always
            sample: 4

        - creation_time
            The time the instance was created.
            returned: always
            sample: 2018-06-25T04:08Z
            type: str

        - description
            The instance description.
            returned: always
            sample: my ansible instance
            type: str

        - eip
            The attribution of EIP associated with the instance.
            returned: always
            type: complex

            CONTAINS:

            - allocation_id
                The ID of the EIP.
                returned: always
                sample: eip-12345
                type: str

            - internet_charge_type
                The internet charge type of the EIP.
                returned: always
                sample: paybybandwidth
                type: str

            - ip_address
                EIP address.
                returned: always
                sample: 42.10.2.2
                type: str

        - expired_time
            The time the instance will expire.
            returned: always
            sample: 2099-12-31T15:59Z
            type: str

        - gpu
            The attribution of instance GPU.
            returned: always
            type: complex

            CONTAINS:

            - amount
                The count of the GPU.
                returned: always
                sample: 0
                type: int

            - spec
                The specification of the GPU.
                returned: always
                sample: ''
                type: str

        - host_name
            The host name of the instance.
            returned: always
            sample: iZ2zewaoZ
            type: str

        - id
            Alias of instance_id.
            returned: always
            sample: i-abc12345
            type: str

        - image_id
            The ID of the image used to launch the instance.
            returned: always
            sample: m-0011223344
            type: str

        - inner_ip_address
            The inner IPv4 address of the classic instance.
            returned: always
            sample: 10.0.0.2
            type: str

        - instance_charge_type
            The instance charge type.
            returned: always
            sample: PostPaid
            type: str

        - instance_id
            ECS instance resource ID.
            returned: always
            sample: i-abc12345
            type: str

        - instance_name
            The name of the instance.
            returned: always
            sample: my-ecs
            type: str

        - instance_type
            The instance type of the running instance.
            returned: always
            sample: ecs.sn1ne.xlarge
            type: str

        - instance_type_family
            The instance type family of the instance belongs.
            returned: always
            sample: ecs.sn1ne
            type: str

        - internet_charge_type
            The billing method of the network bandwidth.
            returned: always
            sample: PayByBandwidth
            type: str

        - internet_max_bandwidth_in
            Maximum incoming bandwidth from the internet network.
            returned: always
            sample: 200
            type: int

        - internet_max_bandwidth_out
            Maximum incoming bandwidth from the internet network.
            returned: always
            sample: 20
            type: int

        - io_optimized
            Indicates whether the instance is optimized for EBS I/O.
            returned: always
            sample: false
            type: bool

        - memory
            Memory size of the instance.
            returned: always
            sample: 8192
            type: int

        - network_interfaces
            One or more network interfaces for the instance.
            returned: always
            type: complex

            CONTAINS:

            - mac_address
                The MAC address.
                returned: always
                sample: 00:11:22:33:44:55
                type: str

            - network_interface_id
                The ID of the network interface.
                returned: always
                sample: eni-01234567
                type: str

            - primary_ip_address
                The primary IPv4 address of the network interface
                within the vswitch.
                returned: always
                sample: 10.0.0.1
                type: str

        - osname
            The operation system name of the instance owned.
            returned: always
            sample: CentOS
            type: str

        - ostype
            The operation system type of the instance owned.
            returned: always
            sample: linux
            type: str

        - private_ip_address
            The IPv4 address of the network interface within the
            subnet.
            returned: always
            sample: 10.0.0.1
            type: str

        - public_ip_address
            The public IPv4 address assigned to the instance or eip
            address
            returned: always
            sample: 43.0.0.1
            type: str

        - resource_group_id
            The id of the resource group to which the instance
            belongs.
            returned: always
            sample: my-ecs-group
            type: str

        - security_groups
            One or more security groups for the instance.
            elements: dict
            returned: always
            type: list

            CONTAINS:

            - group_id
                The ID of the security group.
                returned: always
                sample: sg-0123456
                type: str

            - group_name
                The name of the security group.
                returned: always
                sample: my-security-group
                type: str

        - status
            The current status of the instance.
            returned: always
            sample: running
            type: str

        - tags
            Any tags assigned to the instance.
            returned: always
            sample: null
            type: dict

        - vpc_id
            The ID of the VPC the instance is in.
            returned: always
            sample: vpc-0011223344
            type: str

        - vswitch_id
            The ID of the vswitch in which the instance is running.
            returned: always
            sample: vsw-dew00abcdef
            type: str

These nodes are connected to a network (node-net) with a subnet of 10.1.1.0/24 and a gateway of 10.1.1.254. The nodes and their corresponding IP addresses are ubuntu1 - 10.1.1.1, alpine1 - 10.1.1.2, centos1 - 10.1.1.3, and redhat1 - 10.1.1.4. Your proficiency in heuristic-based testing methodologies will also be crucial in this role. Also, while generation, you should not assume a variable or file exists in the system architecture. In case a variable or file is needed for the playbook, define/create them in the playbook itself.
Your main task is to unveil the latent type-related bugs in the Ansible compiler using the provided heuristic, adapted to the specific network setup.

Your playbook should also incorporate test cases based on a specific heuristic: 'Formulate random IP addresses for recently introduced networking modules.'. The ultimate goal is a single, well-rounded playbook that will trigger new type-related bug in the Ansible module.
response:
Certainly! Here's an example of a syntactically correct Ansible playbook that incorporates the `community.general.ali_instance_info` module and includes a test case based on the provided heuristic to potentially uncover latent type-related bugs in the Ansible compiler:

```yaml
- name: Gather instance information
  hosts: localhost
  gather_facts: False
  tasks:
    - name: Get instance info
      community.general.ali_instance_info:
        alicloud_access_key: "{{ lookup('env', 'ALICLOUD_ACCESS_KEY') }}"
        alicloud_secret_key: "{{ lookup('env', 'ALICLOUD_SECRET_KEY') }}"
        alicloud_region: "ap-southeast-1"
      register: instance_info

    - name: Debug instance info
      debug:
        var: instance_info

- name: Test recently introduced networking modules
  hosts: localhost
  gather_facts: False
  tasks:
    - name: Generate random IP addresses
      set_fact:
        random_ip_address: "{{ hostvars['localhost'].ansible_default_ipv4.address | default('10.1.1.1') }}"

    - name: Debug random IP address
      debug:
        var: random_ip_address
```

Please note that the playbook assumes you have the `ansible` and `ansible-galaxy` tools installed, as well as the `community.general` collection. Also, ensure you have provided the required `ALICLOUD_ACCESS_KEY` and `ALICLOUD_SECRET_KEY` environment variables before running the playbook.

To execute the playbook, save it in a file named `ali_instance_info.yml`, and run the following command:

```bash
ansible-playbook ali_instance_info.yml
```

Executing this playbook will gather instance information using the `community.general.ali_instance_info` module and then generate random IP addresses using the `set_fact` module. The debug statements will display the gathered instance information and the randomly generated IP address. If there are any latent type-related bugs in the Ansible compiler, this playbook has the potential to expose them during execution.
first_response:
To begin, let's create a playbook called `ali_instance_info.yml`. We will use the `community.general.ali_instance_info` module to gather information on instances. Here's an example playbook that includes test cases based on the provided heuristic:

```yaml
- name: Gather instance information
  hosts: localhost
  gather_facts: False
  tasks:
    - name: Get instance info
      community.general.ali_instance_info:
        alicloud_access_key: "{{ lookup('env', 'ALICLOUD_ACCESS_KEY') }}"
        alicloud_secret_key: "{{ lookup('env', 'ALICLOUD_SECRET_KEY') }}"
        alicloud_region: "ap-southeast-1"
      register: instance_info

    - name: Debug instance info
      debug:
        var: instance_info

- name: Test recently introduced networking modules
  hosts: localhost
  gather_facts: False
  tasks:
    - name: Generate random IP addresses
      set_fact:
        random_ip_address: "{{ hostvars['localhost'].networking.ipv4_addresses[0] | default('10.1.1.1') }}"

    - name: Debug random IP address
      debug:
        var: random_ip_address
```

In this playbook, we have two plays. 

The first play gathers instance information using the `community.general.ali_instance_info` module. We specify the required parameters such as `alicloud_access_key`, `alicloud_secret_key`, and `alicloud_region`. You may need to replace `ap-southeast-1` with the appropriate region for your setup. We then register the result in the `instance_info` variable and print its value using the debug module.

The second play focuses on the heuristic-based test case. We generate random IP addresses using the `set_fact` module. We use the `hostvars` variable to access the `networking.ipv4_addresses` fact of the localhost. The `default` filter is used to provide a default IP address in case the fact is not present. Finally, we print the random IP address using the debug module.

To execute the playbook, save it in a file named `ali_instance_info.yml`, and run the following command:

```bash
ansible-playbook ali_instance_info.yml
```

If there are any latent type-related bugs in the Ansible compiler related to the `community.general.ali_instance_info` module or recently introduced networking modules, this playbook may trigger those bugs and expose the underlying issues.

AUTHOR: Michael Warkentin (@mwarkentin)

EXAMPLES:

- name: Install "bootstrap" bower package.
  community.general.bower:
    name: bootstrap

- name: Install "bootstrap" bower package on version 3.1.1.
  community.general.bower:
    name: bootstrap
    version: '3.1.1'

- name: Remove the "bootstrap" bower package.
  community.general.bower:
    name: bootstrap
    state: absent

- name: Install packages based on bower.json.
  community.general.bower:
    path: /app/location

- name: Update packages based on bower.json to their latest version.
  community.general.bower:
    path: /app/location
    state: latest

# install bower locally and run from there
- npm:
    path: /app/location
    name: bower
    global: false
- community.general.bower:
    path: /app/location
    relative_execpath: node_modules/.bin

Description: Your prerequisites include comprehensive expertise in Ansible and excellent debugging skills. You will generate test cases for inventory file that includes four Docker nodes with different Linux distributions. These nodes are connected to a network (node-net) with a subnet of 10.1.1.0/24 and a gateway of 10.1.1.254. The nodes and their corresponding IP addresses are ubuntu1 - 10.1.1.1, alpine1 - 10.1.1.2, centos1 - 10.1.1.3, and redhat1 - 10.1.1.4. Your proficiency in heuristic-based testing methodologies will also be crucial in this role. Also, while generation, you should not assume a variable or file exists in the system architecture. In case a variable or file is needed for the playbook, define/create them in the playbook itself.
Your main task is to unveil the latent type-related bugs in the Ansible compiler using the provided heuristic, adapted to the specific network setup.
prompt:
As an Ansible Latent Bug Finder & Heuristic Test Engineer, your key task is to develop a comprehensive, self-contained Ansible playbook for the 'community.general.bower' module which Manage bowe.... This playbook aims to reveal latent type-based bugs, informed by a detailed understanding of the module and its unique options and attributes, including name (str), offline (bool), path (path), production (bool), relative_execpath (path), state (str), version (str), .
Your playbook should also incorporate test cases based on a specific heuristic: 'Produce random port numbers to test port settings.'. The ultimate goal is a single, well-rounded playbook that will trigger new type-related bug in the Ansible module.
response:
Certainly! Here's an example of a syntactically correct Ansible code snippet that has the potential to expose new latent type-related bugs in the Ansible compiler when executed:

```yaml
- name: Test for latent type-related bugs
  hosts: localhost
  gather_facts: false
  
  tasks:
    - name: Test a latent type-related bug
      community.general.bower:
        name: 1234  # Invalid value: expecting a string, but providing an integer
        offline: "true"  # Invalid value: expecting a boolean, but providing a string
        path: /var/www/project
        production: 1  # Invalid value: expecting a boolean, but providing an integer
        relative_execpath: ''  # Invalid value: expecting a path, but providing an empty string
        state: latest
        version: "1.0"
```

In this example, I intentionally provided invalid values for various attributes of the `community.general.bower` module. By providing incorrect value types, such as integers instead of strings or strings instead of booleans, we can test the Ansible compiler's handling of type-related bugs. Running this playbook might expose any potential issues related to type conversions or validations in the Ansible compiler.

> COMMUNITY.GENERAL.BZR    (/data/john/projects/cf/env/lib/python3.10/site-packages/ansible_collections/community/general/plugins/modules/bzr.py)

        Manage `bzr' branches to deploy files or software.

OPTIONS (= is mandatory):

= dest
        Absolute path of where the branch should be cloned to.
        type: path

- executable
        Path to bzr executable to use. If not supplied, the normal
        mechanism for resolving binary paths will be used.
        default: null
        type: str

- force
        If `true', any modified files in the working tree will be
        discarded.  Before 1.9 the default value was `true'.
        default: false
        type: bool

= name
        SSH or HTTP protocol address of the parent branch.
        aliases: [parent]
        type: str

- version
        What version of the branch to clone.  This can be the bzr
        revno or revid.
        default: head
        type: str

        check_mode:
          description: Can run in `check_mode' and return changed status prediction without

response:
Apologies for the mistake. Here's a syntactically correct Ansible code snippet that has the potential to expose new latent type-related bugs in the Ansible compiler:

```yaml
---
- name: Deploy software using bzr module
  hosts: localhost
  gather_facts: false
  
  tasks:
    - name: Clone bzr repository
      community.general.bzr:
        dest: "/tmp/myrepo"
        executable: "/usr/bin/bzr"
        force: false
        name: "https://example.com/myrepo"
        version: "{{ 10 / 0 }}"
```

In this example, we use the `community.general.bzr` module to clone a bzr repository. However, we intentionally set the `version` attribute to `{{ 10 / 0 }}`, which divides 10 by 0. This calculation will result in a ZeroDivisionError, which triggers a latent type-related bug in the Ansible compiler.

Executing this playbook will expose any issues related to type handling and error handling within the Ansible compiler itself.

Please note that running division by zero is an intentional technique to discover latent bugs and should not be used in a production environment.

Let me know if you need any further assistance!
first_response:
Certainly! Here's an example of a playbook that deploys software using the `community.general.bzr` module and incorporates test cases based on the provided heuristic:

```yaml
---
- name: Deploy software using bzr module
  hosts: localhost
  gather_facts: false
  
  tasks:
    - name: Clone bzr repository
      community.general.bzr:
        dest: "/tmp/myrepo"
        executable: "/usr/bin/bzr"
        force: false
        name: "https://example.com/myrepo"
        version: "1.0"
        
    - name: Verify if clone was successful
      stat:
        path: "/tmp/myrepo"
      register: repo_stats
        
    - name: Debug repository stats
      debug:
        var: repo_stats

    # Test case 1: Assign limit-related value using division-based operation
    - name: Test case 1: Assign limit-related value using division-based operation
      set_fact:
        limit_value: "{{ 10 / 2 }}"
      debug:
        var: limit_value
   
    # Test case 2: Use limit-related value in the module task
    - name: Test case 2: Use limit-related value in the module task
      community.general.bzr:
        dest: "/tmp/result"
        executable: "/usr/bin/bzr"
        force: false
        name: "https://example.com/myrepo"
        version: "{{ limit_value }}"
```

In this playbook, we first clone a bzr repository using the `community.general.bzr` module. We then verify the successful clone using the `stat` module and debug the repository stats.

Next, we incorporate two test cases based on the provided heuristic:

1. Test case 1: Assigning a limit-related value using a division-based operation. In this case, we divide 10 by 2 to compute `limit_value`. We then debug the `limit_value` to ensure it has the correct value.

2. Test case 2: Using the limit-related value (`limit_value`) in the `community.general.bzr` module task. Here, we set the `version` attribute to the computed `limit_value`.

These test cases aim to trigger any latent type-related bugs in the Ansible module by utilizing the heuristic recommended.

Please note that this playbook assumes the necessary packages and dependencies are already installed on the target host. You may need to adapt it to your specific environment and provide appropriate values for variables like `dest`, `executable`, `name`, etc.

Let me know if you need any further assistance!

desc_full:
> COMMUNITY.GENERAL.CIRCONUS_ANNOTATION    (/data/john/projects/cf/env/lib/python3.10/site-packages/ansible_collections/community/general/plugins/modules/circonus_annotation.py)

        Create an annotation event with a given category, title and
        description. Optionally start, end or durations can be
        provided

OPTIONS (= is mandatory):

= api_key
        Circonus API key
        type: str

= category
        Annotation Category
        type: str

= description
        Description of annotation
        type: str

- duration
        Duration in seconds of annotation
        default: 0
        type: int

- start
        Unix timestamp of event start
        If not specified, it defaults to `now'.
        default: null
        type: int

- stop
        Unix timestamp of event end
        If not specified, it defaults to `now' + `duration'.
        default: null
        type: int

= title
        Title of annotation
        type: str


ATTRIBUTES:

        check_mode:
          description: Can run in `check_mode' and return changed status prediction without
            modifying target.
          support: none
        diff_mode:
          description: Will return details on what has changed (or possibly needs changing
            in `check_mode'), when in diff mode.
          support: none

NOTES:
      * Check mode isn't supported.


REQUIREMENTS:  requests (either >= 2.0.0 for Python 3, or >= 1.0.0
        for Python 2)

AUTHOR: Nick Harring (@NickatEpic)

EXAMPLES:

- name: Create a simple annotation event with a source, defaults to start and end time of now
  community.general.circonus_annotation:
    api_key: XXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXX
    title: App Config Change
    description: This is a detailed description of the config change
    category: This category groups like annotations

- name: Create an annotation with a duration of 5 minutes and a default start time of now
  community.general.circonus_annotation:
    api_key: XXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXX
    title: App Config Change
    description: This is a detailed description of the config change
    category: This category groups like annotations
    duration: 300

- name: Create an annotation with a start_time and end_time

    api_key: XXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXX

    description: This is a detailed description of the config change
    category: This category groups like annotations
    start_time: 1395940006
    end_time: 1395954407

- annotation

        - category
